page.title: 01A Rural Landscape
page.content: The area covered in this survey is part of a peninsula of land between the River Thames to the north and the River Medway to the south. There was one principal settlement, the historic village of Cliffe mentioned in the original Domesday. Then it comprised of meadow, woods of l2 pence value and l church with 2 servants. Life has changed little with the church still dominant in the centre of a village surrounded by farmland, of drained marshes or meadow and cleared fields for cereals. Fruit trees have replaced original woodlands to provide a picturesque scene in late spring when in full bloom.Old traditional buildings are at the heart of the village.
